Sentencas: A theoretical model of solid oxide cells coupled with heterogeneous elementary reactions, electrochemical reactions, electrode microstructure and mass and charge transport is developed and validated.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness

Sentencas: The effects of microstructure, thickness and temperature of air electrode on the cell performance in both solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) and solid oxide fuel cell (soFq are individually discussed.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness

Sentencas: The simulation results indicate that the growth in the thickness of air electrode reduces the effect of particle diameter while dramatically enlarges the effect of porosity.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness

Sentencas: The microstructure and thickness of air electrode and temperature have significantly different impacts on solid oxide cells operating in SOEC mode and SOFC mode.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness

Sentencas: The results indicate that the optimizing strategy of air electrode for SOEC and SOFC should be different especially for a thicker air electrode.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness

Sentencas: The proposed model can be a useful tool for bridging the electrode geometry and microstructure design and optimization.
Titulo: Theoretical modeling of air electrode operating in SOFC mode and SOEC mode: The effects of microstructure and thickness
